items.title: Economic Affairs Committee
items.description: The Economic Affairs Committee is one of the five permanent investigative committees in the House of Lords and is charged with considering economic affairs

items.title: International Relations Committee
items.description: The International Relations Committee is appointed to consider the United Kingdom’s international relations

items.title: Secondary Legislation Scrutiny Committee (Sub-Committee B)
items.description: The sub-committee of the Secondary Legislation Scrutiny Committee is appointed to continue the scrutiny work of the main committee

items.title: Justice Committee
items.description: The Justice Committee examines the Lord Chief Justice's Report for 2018

items.title: Secondary Legislation Scrutiny Committee
items.description: The Secondary Legislation Scrutiny Committee is the successor to the Merits of Statutory Instruments Committee which existed until the end of the 2010-12 session

items.title: Transport Committee
items.description: The Transport Committee examines the expenditure, administration and policy of the Department for Transport and its associated public bodies

items.title: Privileges Committee
items.description: The House of Commons Committee of Privileges is appointed to consider specific matters relating to privileges referred to it by the House

items.title: Welsh Affairs Committee
items.description: The Welsh Affairs Committee examines matters within the responsibility of the Secretary of State for Wales (including relations with the National Assembly for Wales)

items.title: Privileges and Conduct (Committee for)
items.description: The Committee for Privileges and Conduct hears complaints of breach of privilege, takes evidence, and reports its recommendations to the Lords

items.title: Selection (Commons)
items.description: The Selection Committee is established to nominate Members to serve on General and Select Committees of the House of Commons

items.title: Middle Level Bill Committee
items.description: The committee is appointed to consider the Middle Level Bill

items.title: Members Estimate Committee
items.description: The Members Estimate Committee considers matters relating to MPs’ pay and allowances on behalf of the House of Commons. It has the same membership as the House of Commons Commission

items.title: EU Select Committee
items.description: The EU Select Committee is appointed to consider EU documents and other matters relating to the EU

items.title: Bribery Act 2010 Committee
items.description: The committee is appointed to consider and report on the Bribery Act 2010

items.title: Petitions Committee
items.description: The Petitions Committee considers public petitions presented to the House and e-petitions submitted through the House of Commons and Government e-petitions site

items.title: Human Rights
items.description: The Joint Committee on Human Rights considers human rights issues in the UK

items.title: Intergenerational Fairness and Provision Committee
items.description: The committee is appointed to concider the long-term implications of Government policy on intergenerational fairness and provision

items.title: High Speed Rail (West Midlands – Crewe) Bill Select Committee
items.description: Select Committee on the High Speed Rail Bill provides individuals and bodies directly and specially affected by the Bill with the opportunity to object to the Bill’s specific provisions and to seek its amendment

items.title: NERC Act 2006 Committee
items.description: The NERC Act 2006 Committee was appointed on 29 June 2017 to consider and report on the Natural Environment and Rural Communities Act 2006

items.title: Hybrid Instruments Committee
items.description: The Hybrid Instruments Committee decides whether an opposed hybrid instrument should have its merits enquired into by a Select Committee set up for that purpose

items.title: Statutory Instruments Committee (Commons)
items.description: The Statutory Instruments Committee is responsible for scrutinising all statutory instruments laid before the House of Commons (its work is closely related to that of the Joint Committee on Statutory Instruments)

items.title: Public Accounts Committee
items.description: The Public Accounts Committee examines reports produced by the Comptroller and Auditor General (C&AG) on value for money (VFM) studies of economy, efficiency and effectiveness with which government departments and other bodies have used their resources

items.title: EU Home Affairs Sub-Committee
items.description: The Sub-Committee scrutinises EU proposals on health, education and sport and home affairs including police cooperation, asylum and migration, counter-terrorism, and civil protection

items.title: Commons Reference Group on Representation and Inclusion
Finance Committee
items.description: The Finance Committee considers expenditure on, and the administration of, services for the House of Commons

items.title: EU Financial Affairs Sub-Committee
items.description: The Sub-Committee scrutinises EU proposals on economic and financial affairs

items.title: European Scrutiny Committee
items.description: The European Scrutiny Committee assesses the legal/political importance of EU documents

items.title: Panel of Chairs
items.description: Members of the Panel of Chairs are appointed by the Speaker to chair Public Bill Committees and other general committees

items.title: Public Administration and Constitutional Affairs Committee
items.description: PACAC examines constitutional issues and the quality and standards of administration within the Civil Service. It also scrutinises the reports of the Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman

items.title: International Trade Committee
items.description: The International Trade Committee question the Minister of State

items.title: Draft Health Service Safety Investigations Bill
items.description: The Joint Committee is appointed to consider the draft bill on health service safety investigations

items.title: Information Committee (Lords)
items.description: The Information Committee considers the House's information and communications services, including the Library and Parliamentary Archives

items.title: Economic Affairs Finance Bill Sub-Committee
items.description: The Economic Affairs Finance Bill Sub-Committee considers aspects of the Finance Bill from the point of view of technical issues of tax administration, clarification and simplification

items.title: Procedure Committee (Commons)
items.description: The Procedure Committee considers, and makes recommendations on the practices and procedures of the House of Commons

items.title: Ecclesiastical Committee
items.description: The Ecclesiastical Committee examines draft measures presented to it by the Legislative Committee of the General Synod of the Church of England

items.title: Regenerating Seaside Towns Committee
items.description: The committee is appointed to to consider the regeneration of seaside towns and communities

items.title: Members' Expenses Committee
items.description: The Committee considered matters relating to Members’ expenses referred to it by the House

items.title: International Development Committee
items.description: The International Development Committee examines the expenditure, administration and policy of the Department for International Development and its associated public bodies

items.title: Consolidation Bills
items.description: The Joint Committee on Consolidation Bills considers Bills which bring together a number of existing Acts of Parliament on the same subject into one Act without amending the law, although they occasionally contain minor corrections and improvements

items.title: Speaker's Committee for IPSA
items.description: The Speaker's Committee for the Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority considers the proposed candidates for Chair and members of Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority

items.title: Lord Speaker's committee on the size of the House
items.description: The Lord Speaker's committee was established to explore methods by which the size of the House can be reduced, commensurate with its current role and functions

items.title: Delegated Powers and Regulatory Reform Committee
items.description: The Delegated Powers and Regulatory Reform Committee scrutinises proposals in bills to delegate legislative power from Parliament to another body and also examines Legislative Reform Orders

items.title: Standing Orders (Private Bills) (Commons)
items.description: The Standing Orders Committee is charged with deciding whether or not to dispense with any Standing Order, which the Examiners of Petitions for Private Bills consider has not been complied with

items.title: Women and Equalities Committee
items.description: The Women and Equalities Committee is a new select committee appointed to examine the Government’s performance on equalities issues.

items.title: High Speed Rail (London - West Midlands) Bill Select Committee (Lords)
items.description: The committee is appointed to consider the High Speed Rail (London - West Midlands) Bill

items.title: Public Accounts Commission
items.description: The principal role of the Public Accounts Commission is to examine the National Audit Office Estimates, to consider Reports from the appointed auditor of the National Audit Office, and to report from time to time

items.title: Palace of Westminster
items.description: The Joint Committee on the Palace of Westminster is appointed to consider the restoration and renewal project for the Palace of Westminster

items.title: EU Energy and Environment Sub-Committee
items.description: The Sub-Committee scrutinises EU proposals on agriculture, fisheries, environment and energy including the Common Agricultural and Fisheries Policies (CAP and CFP), environmental protection, climate change, maritime affairs and energy policy

items.title: Science and Technology Committee (Lords)
items.description: The Science and Technology Committee is appointed to consider science and technology. It does this principally through undertaking inquiries

items.title: Political Polling and Digital Media
items.description: The committee is appointed to consider the effects of political polling and digital media on politics

items.title: Backbench Business Committee
items.description: The Backbench Business Committee chooses the business to be debated during backbench time

items.title: Exiting the European Union Committee
items.description: The Exiting the European Union Committee examines the expenditure, administration and policy of the Department of Exiting the European Union

items.title: Liaison Committee (Lords)
items.description: The Liaison Committee allocates resources between select committees, reviews the select committee work of the House, considers requests for ad hoc committees and reports to the House with recommendations

items.title: Housing, Communities and Local Government Committee
items.description: The Housing, Communities and Local Government Committee examines the expenditure, administration, and policy of the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government

items.title: Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy Committee
items.description: Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy Committee examines the administration, expenditure and policy of the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy and its associated public bodies

items.title: Sub-Committee on the Work of the Independent Commission for Aid Impact
items.description: The Sub-Committee on the Work of ICAI examines the work of the Independent Commission for Aid Impact

items.title: Environmental Audit Committee
items.description: The Environmental Audit Committee considers how well government policies and programmes contribute to environmental protection and sustainable development, and it audits performance against targets in those areas

items.title: Liaison Committee (Commons)
items.description: The Liaison Committee considers general matters relating to the work of select committees

items.title: National Security Strategy
items.description: The Joint Committee on the National Security Strategy is appointed to consider the National Security Strategy

items.title: Education Committee
items.description: The Education Committee examines the administration, expenditure and policy of the Department for Education and also covers the work of non-departmental public bodies

items.title: Rural Economy Committee
items.description: The committee is appointed to consider the rural economy, and to make recommendations.

items.title: Home Affairs Committee
items.description: The Home Affairs Committee examines the policy, administration and expenditure of the Home Office and its associated bodies

items.title: Work and Pensions Committee
items.description: The Work and Pensions Committee examines the expenditure, administration and policy of the Department for Work and Pensions and its associated public bodies

items.title: EU External Affairs Sub-Committee
items.description: The Sub-Committee scrutinises EU proposals on external affairs including European defence and security, international trade and development and foreign affairs

items.title: Speaker's Committee on the Electoral Commission
items.description: The Speaker's Committee on the Electoral Commission was established by the same Act of Parliament that created the Electoral Commission

items.title: House Committee
items.description: The House Committee sets the policy framework for the administration of the House of Lords

items.title: Administration Committee
items.description: The Administration Committee considers the services that the House of Commons provides for Members of Parliament, staff and the general public

items.title: Science and Technology Committee (Commons)
items.description: The Science and Technology Committee ensures that government policy and decision-making is based on good scientific and engineering advice and evidence

items.title: Digital, Culture, Media and Sport Committee
items.description: The Digital, Culture, Media and Sport Committee examines the expenditure, administration and policy of the Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport and its associated bodies

items.title: Defence Committee
items.description: The Defence Committee examines the expenditure, administration, and policy of the Ministry of Defence and its associated public bodies

items.title: House of Commons Commission
items.description: As the overall supervisory body of the House of Commons Administration, the House of Commons Commission is responsible for the administration and services of the House

items.title: Works of Art (Speaker's Advisory Committee)
items.description: The Speaker's Advisory Committee on Works of Art is appointed by the Speaker to advise on matters relating to works of art in the House of Commons

items.title: EU Internal Market Sub-Committee
items.description: The Sub-Committee scrutinises EU proposals on Internal Market, Infrastructure and Employment including energy, industry, transport, communications, research and space

items.title: Constitution Committee
items.description: The Constitution Committee examines all public bills for constitutional implications and investigates broad constitutional issues

items.title: Secondary Legislation Scrutiny Committee (Sub-Committee A)
items.description: The sub-committee of the Secondary Legislation Scrutiny Committee is appointed to continue the scrutiny work of the main committee.

items.title: Environment, Food and Rural Affairs Committee
items.description: The Environment, Food and Rural Affairs Committee examines the expenditure, administration, and policy of the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (Defra) and its associated public bodies

items.title: Foreign Affairs Committee
items.description: The Foreign Affairs Committee examines the expenditure, administration and policy of the Foreign and Commonwealth Office and its associated public bodies

items.title: Standards Committee
items.description: The House of Commons Committee on Standards oversees the work of the Parliamentary Commissioner for Standards

items.title: Intellectual Property (Unjustified Threats) Bill Committee
items.description: The committee is appointed to consider the Intellectual Property (Unjustified Threats) Bill [HL]

items.title: Northern Ireland Affairs Committee
items.description: The Northern Ireland Affairs Committee examines the expenditure, administration and policy of the Northern Ireland Office and its associated public bodies

items.title: Regulatory Reform Committee
items.description: The Regulatory Reform Committee scrutinises government proposals for draft legislative reform orders

items.title: Science and Technology Sub-Committee I
items.description: The Science and Technology Sub-Committee has launched an inquiry into Higher Education in STEM Subjects

items.title: Arms Export Controls (Committees on)
items.description: The Committees on Arms Export Controls are made up of members of the committees on Business, Innovation and Skills; Defence; Foreign Affairs and International Development. They examine the government's policy on strategic export controls

items.title: European Statutory Instruments Committee
items.description: European Statutory Instruments Committee sifts proposed negative instruments following the passing of the EU (Withdrawal) Act 2018

items.title: Defence Sub-Committee
items.description: The Defence Sub-Committee's news page

items.title: Statutory Instruments (Joint Committee)
items.description: The Joint Committee on Statutory Instruments scrutinises statutory instruments made in exercise of powers granted by Act of Parliament

items.title: High Speed Rail (London - West Midlands) Bill Select Committee (Commons)
items.description: The Select Committee on the High Speed Rail Bill provides individuals and bodies directly and specially affected by the Bill with the opportunity to object to the Bill’s specific provisions and to seek its amendment.

items.title: Sub-Committee on Education, Skills and the Economy
items.description: The Sub-Committee on Education, Skills and the Economy examines how education and skills-related issues affect business and the economy.

items.title: Draft Parliamentary Buildings Bill
items.description: The Joint Committee is appointed to consider the draft bill on parliamentary buildings

items.title: Draft Protection of Charities Bill
items.description: The Joint Committee is appointed to consider the draft Protection of Charities Bill

items.title: Health and Social Care Committee
items.description: The Health and Social Care Committee examines the policy, administration and expenditure of the Department of Health and Social Care and its associated bodies

items.title: Scottish Affairs Committee
items.description: The Scottish Affairs Committee examines the expenditure, administration and policy of the Scotland Office and its associated public bodies

items.title: Standing Orders (Private Bills) (Lords)
items.description: The Standing Orders Committee is charged with deciding whether or not to dispense with any Standing Order, which the Examiners of Petitions for Private Bills consider has not been complied with

items.title: Treasury Committee
items.description: The Treasury Committee take evidence on economic crime

items.title: Leader's Group on Governance
items.description: The Leader's group is reviewing governance in the House of Lords

items.title: Procedure Committee (Lords)
items.description: The Procedure Committee reviews House procedures

items.title: Works of Art Advisory Panel (Lords)
items.description: The Works of Art Advisory Panel considers matters relating to works of art and artistic heritage

items.title: Communications Committee
items.description: The Communications Committee considers the media and the creative industries

items.title: Draft Investigatory Powers Bill
items.description: The committee is appointed to consider the draft Investigatory Powers Bill

items.title: EU Justice Sub-Committee
items.description: The Sub-Committee scrutinises EU proposals on civil and criminal justice, fundamental rights,the EU's institutions, agencies and other bodies, EU citizenship, consumer protection, intellectual property and culture policy

items.title: Schools
items.description: A Bill to enable schools to select pupils on the basis of published criteria; to allow schools to determine maximum class sizes; to remove restrictions on the expansion of the number of pupils in schools and on the creation of new schools; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Violent Crime (Sentences)
items.description: A Bill to increase the minimum custodial sentence on conviction for possession of a knife or other offensive weapon for an offender aged 18 years or over and to increase the minimum period of detention and training order for a person aged 16 or 17; to set a minimum custodial sentence on conviction for an offender in possession of a knife or other weapon and intending to commit any offence or having such a weapon available to use in committing murder; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Data Protection
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the regulation of the processing of information relating to individuals; to make provision in connection with the Information Commissioner's functions under certain regulations relating to information; to make provision for a direct marketing code of conduct; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Refugees (Family Reunion)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for leave to enter or remain in the United Kingdom to be granted to the family members of refugees and to refugees who are family members of British citizens and settled persons, to provide for legal aid to be made available for refugee family reunion cases, and for connected purposes

items.title: BBC (Independence)
items.description: A Bill to provide for the independence of the British Broadcasting Corporation

items.title: Anonymity (Arrested Persons)
items.description: A Bill to prohibit the publication of certain information regarding persons who have been arrested until they have been charged with an offence; to set out the circumstances where such information can be published without committing an offence; and for connected purposes

items.title: Private Landlords (Registration)
items.description: A Bill to require all private landlords in England to be registered; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Tenant Fees
items.description: Make provision prohibiting landlords and letting agents from requiring certain payments to be made or certain other steps to be taken; to make provision about the payment of holding deposits; to make provision about enforcement and about the lead enforcement authority; to amend the provisions of the Consumer Rights Act 2015 about information to be provided by letting agents and the provisions of the Housing and Planning Act 2016 about client money protection schemes; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Parental Leave and Pay Arrangements (Publication)
items.description: A Bill to require employers with more than 250 employees to publish information about parental leave, and pay in the course of such leave; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Parliamentary Constituencies (Amendment)
items.description: To amend the Parliamentary Constituencies Act 1986 to make provision about the number and size of parliamentary constituencies in the United Kingdom; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Armed Forces Representative Body
items.description: a Bill to create a staff association to represent the interests of members of Her Majesty’s Armed Forces as employees; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Certificate of Loss
items.description: A Bill to make provision for a certificate to be issued to mothers in respect of miscarried and stillborn children not eligible for registration under the Births and Deaths Registration Act 1953; for establishing a database for archiving the certificate and recording information about the miscarriage or still birth; and for connected purposes

items.title: Immigration Control (Gross Human Rights Abuses)
items.description: A Bill to enable the Secretary of State, or an immigration officer to refuse entry, or to vary or curtail leave to enter or remain already granted, to a person who is a non-UK or non-EEA national who is known to be, or to have been, involved in gross human rights abuses

items.title: Domestic Gas and Electricity (Tariff Cap)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the imposition of a cap on rates charged to domestic customers for the supply of gas and electricity; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Assaults on Emergency Workers (Offences)
items.description: To make provision about offences when perpetrated against emergency workers, and persons assisting such workers; to make certain offences aggravated when perpetrated against such workers in the exercise of their duty; to require persons suspected of certain assaults against such workers which may pose a health risk to provide intimate samples and to make it an offence, without reasonable excuse, to refuse to provide such samples; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Human Rights and Responsibilities
items.description: A Bill to require persons bringing claims or proceedings under the Human Rights Act 1998 to satisfy a test of reasonableness and equity; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Family Relationships (Impact Assessment and Targets)
items.description: A Bill to require public bodies to accompany any proposal for a change in public expenditure, administration or policy with a family impact assessment; and to require the Secretary of State to report on the costs and benefits of extending family impact assessments to local authorities and to establish and evaluate progress towards objectives and targets for family stability.

items.title: BBC Licence Fee (Civil Penalty)
items.description: A Bill to make provision to decriminalise the non-payment of the BBC licence fee.

items.title: Domestic Properties (Minimum Energy Performance)
items.description: A Bill to require the Secretary of State to ensure that domestic properties have a minimum energy performance rating of C on an Energy Performance Certificate; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Northern Ireland (Executive Formation and Exercise of Functions)
items.description: To facilitate the formation of an Executive in Northern Ireland by extending the time for making Ministerial appointments following the election of the Northern Ireland Assembly on 2 March 2017; and to make provision about the exercise of governmental functions in, or in relation to, Northern Ireland in the absence of Northern Ireland Ministers.

items.title: Access to Banking Services
items.description: A Bill to make provision about access by customers, in particular those in rural areas, to banking services; to make provision for community banking hubs; to review access to banking services through the Post Office network; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Marriage and Civil Partnership (Consent)
items.description: A Bill to require the person registering a marriage or civil partnership to attest the valid consent of both parties to the marriage or civil partnership before it is solemnized; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Unpaid Work Experience (Prohibition)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the prohibition of unpaid work experience exceeding four weeks, and for connected matters

items.title: Property Boundaries (Resolution of Disputes)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the resolution of disputes concerning the location or placement of boundaries and private rights of way relating to the title of an estate in land; and for connected purposes

items.title: Judicial Appointments and Retirements (Age Limits)
items.description: A Bill to repeal provisions for the compulsory retirement of holders of judicial office on the grounds of age; to remove upper age limits for appointment to judicial office; and for connected purposes.

items.title: House of Peers
items.description: A bill to provide for the renaming of the House of Lords as the House of Peers.

items.title: Fruit and Vegetables (Classification)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for fruit and vegetables to be classified by flavour, condition and size for the purposes of sale in the UK; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Business of the House Commission
items.description: A Bill to create a Business of the House Commission to regulate the timetabling of business in the House of Commons; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Crime (Overseas Production Orders)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about overseas production orders

items.title: Hospital Car Parking Charges (Abolition)
items.description: A Bill to prohibit charging for car parking at NHS hospitals for patients, staff and visitors; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Housing and Planning (Local Decision-Making)
items.description: A Bill to remove powers of the Secretary of State in relation to the location of and planning permission for new housing developments; to give local authorities powers to establish requirements on such developments in their area, including requirements on the proportion of affordable and social housing; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Green Belt (Protection)
items.description: A Bill to establish a national register of green belt land in England; to restrict the ability of local authorities to de-designate green belt land; to make provision about future development of de-designated green belt land; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Kew Gardens (Leases)
items.description: A Bill to provide that the Secretary of State’s powers in relation to the management of the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, include the power to grant a lease in respect of land for a period of up to 150 years

items.title: European Union (Withdrawal)
items.description: A Bill to repeal the European Communities Act 1972 and make other provision in connection with the withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the EU.

items.title: Northern Ireland Budget
items.description:
To authorise the issue out of the Consolidated Fund of Northern Ireland of certain sums for the service of the year ending 31 March 2019; to appropriate those sums for specified purposes; to authorise the Department of Finance in Northern Ireland to
borrow on the credit of the appropriated sums; to authorise the use for the public service of certain resources (including accruing resources) for the year ending 31 March 2019; and to repeal certain spent provisions.

items.title: Laser Misuse (Vehicles)
items.description: A bill to make provision creating a new offence of shining or directing a laser beam towards a vehicle.

items.title: Student Loans (Debt Interest)
items.description: A Bill to limit the rate of interest chargeable on outstanding student loan debt; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Wild Animals in Circuses
items.description: A Bill to make provision to prohibit the use of wild animals in travelling circuses.

items.title: Health and Social Care (National Data Guardian)
items.description: A Bill to establish, and make provision about, the National Data Guardian for Health and Social Care; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Local Health Scrutiny
items.description: A Bill to make provision about health scrutiny by local authorities, including scrutiny of clinical commissioning groups' decisions; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Refugees (Family Reunion) (No. 2)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for leave to enter or remain in the United Kingdom to be granted to the family members of refugees and of people granted humanitarian protection; to provide for legal aid to be made available for such family reunion cases; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Courts and Tribunals (Judiciary and Functions of Staff)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the judiciary and the functions of the staff of courts and tribunals

items.title: Homeless People (Current Accounts)
items.description: A Bill to require banks to provide current accounts for homeless people seeking work; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Opticians Act 1989 (Amendment)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the sale of adjustable focus spectacles

items.title: Finance
items.description: A Bill to grant certain duties, to alter other duties, and to amend the law relating to the national debt and the public revenue, and to make further provision in connection with finance.

items.title: DiGeorge Syndrome (Review and National Health Service Duty)
items.description: A Bill to require the Secretary of State to conduct a review into DiGeorge (22q11 deletion) syndrome; to require the National Health Service to publish a strategy after the review is complete; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Alcohol (Minimum Pricing) (England)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the minimum price at which alcohol may be sold from licensed premises in England; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Healthcare (International Arrangements)
items.description: A Bill to Make provision about paying and arranging for healthcare provided outside the United Kingdom and giving effect to healthcare agreements; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Smart Meters
items.description: A Bill to extend the period for the Secretary of State to exercise powers relating to smart metering and to provide for a special administration regime for a smart meter communication licensee.

items.title: Public Service Broadcasters (Privatisation)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the privatisation of the British Broadcasting Corporation and Channel 4; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Civil Partnership Act 2004 (Amendment) (Mixed Sex Couples)
items.description: A Bill to amend the Civil Partnership Act 2004 to make provision for mixed sex couples to enter into a civil partnership

items.title: Freehold Properties (Management Charges and Shared Facilities)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the regulation of fees charged by management companies to freeholders of residential properties; to make provision for self-management of shared facilities by such freeholders; to require management companies to ensure shared facilities are of an adequate standard; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Offensive Weapons
items.description: To make provision for and in connection with offences relating to offensive weapons.

items.title: Civil Partnerships, Marriages and Deaths (Registration Etc.)
items.description: To provide that opposite sex couples may enter a civil partnership; to make provision about the registration of the names of the mother of each party to a marriage or civil partnership; to make provision about the registration of stillborn deaths; to give coroners the power to investigate stillborn deaths; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Bathing Waters
items.description: A Bill to give the Environment Agency additional powers to control and reduce discharge from combined sewer overflows; to make other provision about bathing water quality and clean beach initiatives; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Ovarian Cancer (Public Awareness)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about public awareness measures in respect of the symptoms of and screening for ovarian cancer; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Benefits and Public Services (Restriction)
items.description: A Bill to make provision to restrict the entitlement of non-UK citizens to publicly-funded benefits and services; and for connected purposes.

items.title: European Union (Referendum on the Withdrawal Agreement)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the holding of a referendum in the United Kingdom and Gibraltar on whether the United Kingdom should accept the outcome of negotiations between the Government and the European Union regarding the United Kingdom’s exit from the European Union

items.title: Stamp Duty
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the reduction of stamp duty rates on residential property.

items.title: Prime Minister (Accountability to House of Commons)
items.description: A Bill to impose duties on the Prime Minister relating to accountability to the House of Commons; to require the Prime Minister to be available to answer questions in that House on at least two occasions during a sitting week except in specified circumstances; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Foreign Nationals (Criminal Offender and Prisoner Removal)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the removal from the United Kingdom of foreign national criminal offenders and of prisoners who are citizens of European Union Member States; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Voting Age (Reduction)
items.description: A Bill to extend the franchise for parliamentary and other elections to all citizens over the age of 16 years

items.title: National Health Service
items.description: A Bill to re-establish the Secretary of State’s legal duty as to the National Health Service in England and to make provision about the other duties of the Secretary of State in that regard; to make provision for establishing Integrated Health Boards and about the administration and accountability of the National Health Service in England; to make provision about ending private finance initiatives in the National Health Service in England; to exclude the National Health Service from international trade agreements; to repeal sections 38 and 39 of the Immigration Act 2014; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Cosmetic Surgery (Standards)
items.description: A Bill to make provision to include medical practitioners specialising in cosmetic surgery in the Specialist Register for medical practitioners

items.title: Marriage and Civil Partnership (Minimum Age)
items.description: A Bill to raise the minimum age of consent to marriage or civil partnership to eighteen; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Ecumenical Marriage
items.description: A Bill to make provision for marriages taking place in any Church of England chapel licensed for the solemnization of marriages under sections 20 and 21 of the Marriage Act 1949 to be solemnized according to the rites and ceremonies of Christian denominations other than the Church of England.

items.title: Local Audit (Public Access to Documents)
items.description: A Bill to amend the Local Audit and Accountability Act 2014 to extend public access to certain documents that are commercially confidential and documents relating to NHS bodies in England; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Legalisation of Cannabis (Medicinal Purposes)
items.description: A Bill to allow the production, supply, possession and use of cannabis and cannabis resin for medicinal purposes; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Voter Registration
items.description: A Bill to prohibit persons from being registered to vote in Parliamentary elections in more than one constituency; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Creditworthiness Assessment
items.description: A Bill to require certain matters to be taken into account when assessing a borrower’s creditworthiness

items.title: EEA Nationals (Indefinite Leave to Remain)
items.description: A Bill to amend the Immigration Act 1971 to grant indefinite leave to remain in the United Kingdom to all EEA nationals, their family members and extended family members who are resident in the United Kingdom on the date of exit from the European Union

items.title: Secure Tenancies (Victims of Domestic Abuse)
items.description: A bill to make provision about the granting of old-style secure tenancies in cases of domestic abuse.

items.title: Manufactured Goods (Trade)
items.description: A Bill to remove certain restrictions on the production and sale of goods manufactured in the United Kingdom for use in the United Kingdom, in connection with the withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the EU; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Parking (Code of Practice)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for and in connection with a code of practice containing guidance about the operation and management of private parking facilities; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Rail Passenger (Compensation)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for a single compensation scheme for passengers across train operators; to require train operators to pay automatic compensation to season ticket holders and certain other passengers where certain standards of service are not met; to allow train operators to recover compensation paid to passengers from Network Rail in certain circumstances; to establish a body to administer rail compensation; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Rating (Property in Common Occupation) and Council Tax (Empty Dwellings)
items.description: A Bill to make provision, where two or more hereditaments occupied or owned by the same person meet certain conditions as to contiguity, for those hereditaments to be treated for the purposes of non-domestic rating as one hereditament; and to increase the percentage by which a billing authority in England may increase the council tax payable in respect of a long-term empty dwelling.

items.title: Department for International Trade (Abolition)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the abolition of the Department for International Trade; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Freedom of Information (Extension)
items.description: A Bill to make providers of social housing, local safeguarding children boards, Electoral Registration Officers, Returning Officers and the Housing Ombudsman public authorities for the purposes of the Freedom of Information Act 2000; to make information held by persons contracting with public authorities subject to the Freedom of Information Act 2000; to extend the powers of the Information Commissioner; and for connected purposes.

items.title: European Union (Approvals)
items.description:
To make provision approving for the purposes of section 8 of the European Union Act 2011 draft decisions under Article 352 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union on the participation of the Republic of Albania and the Republic of
Serbia in the work of the European Union Agency for Fundamental Rights and on the signing and conclusion of an agreement between the European Union and Canada
regarding the application of their competition laws.

items.title: Isham Bypass
items.description: A Bill to impose duties relating to the completion of the Isham Bypass by 31 December 2020; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Anti-Loitering Devices (Regulation)
items.description: A Bill to prohibit the use of certain anti-loitering devices without a licence; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Victims of Terrorism (Pensions and Other Support)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about support for victims who have been severely injured or bereaved as a result of acts of terrorism by an unconnected person or organisation in the United Kingdom; to establish a review of pension support for such victims; to require that review to make proposals for additional support taking account of the effects on occupational pension provision for such victims; and for connected purposes.

items.title: European Union Withdrawal (Evaluation of Effects on Health and Social Care Sectors)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for an independent evaluation of the effects of the United Kingdom’s withdrawal from the European Union on the health and social care sectors; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Road Traffic Offenders (Surrender of Driving Licences etc.) (No. 2)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the surrender, production or other delivery up of driving licences, or test certificates, in relation to certain offences; to make provision in relation to identifying persons in connection with fixed penalty notices, conditional offers and the payment of fixed penalties under the Road Traffic Offenders Act 1988; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Plastics
items.description: A Bill to require the Secretary of State to set, measure, enforce and report on targets for the reduction and recycling of plastic packaging; to require that such targets following the United Kingdom’s withdrawal from the European Union at least match such targets set by the European Union; to establish enforcement mechanisms in respect of such targets and associated provisions; to make provision for support for the development of sustainable alternatives to plastic packaging; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Bat Habitats Regulation
items.description: A Bill to make provision to enhance the protection available for bat habitats in the vicinity of a building site and to limit the protection for bat habitats in buildings used for public worship

items.title: Democratic Political Activity (Funding and Expenditure)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the regulation of funding and expenditure of political parties; to make provision for the phased introduction of a cap on donations to political parties; to make provision for affiliation fees from trades unions and membership organisations to political parties to be counted as individual donations in prescribed circumstances; to make provision for the public funding of political parties; to make provision for the modification of rights of candidates and parties to election addresses; to make provision for limits on political parties’ expenditure between regulated periods; to confer powers on the Electoral Commission, and for connected purposes

items.title: Voyeurism (Offences)
items.description: A Bill to make certain acts of voyeurism an offence.

items.title: Supply and Appropriation (Main Estimates)
items.description: A Bill to authorise the use of resources for the year ending with 31 March 2018; to authorise both the issue of sums out of the Consolidated Fund and the application of income for that year; and to appropriate the supply authorised for that year by this Act and by the Supply and Appropriation (Anticipation and Adjustments) Act 2017.

items.title: Air Travel Organisers' Licensing
items.description: To amend sections 71, 71A and 84 of the Civil Aviation Act 1982, and for connected purposes.

items.title: Energy Consumption (Innovative Technologies)
items.description: A Bill to require the Secretary of State to undertake a public consultation on innovative technologies and energy consumption in households and commercial properties and to report on responses to that consultation and steps to be taken to encourage the development of innovative technologies to reduce energy consumption; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Prisons (Substance Testing)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about substance testing in prisons and similar institutions.

items.title: Voyeurism (Offences) (No. 2)
items.description: To make certain acts of voyeurism an offence, and for connected purposes.

items.title: Fetal Dopplers (Regulation)
items.description: A Bill to regulate the sale and use of fetal dopplers; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Financial Guidance and Claims
items.description: A bill to make provision establishing a new financial guidance body; to make provision about the funding of debt advice in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland; and to make provision about the regulation of claims management services.

items.title: Kew Gardens (Leases) (No. 2)
items.description: A Bill to Provide that the Secretary of State’s powers in relation to the management of the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, include the power to grant a lease in respect of land for a period of up to 150 years.

items.title: Banking and Post Office Services (Rural Areas and Small Communities)
items.description: A Bill to require banks to provide certain services in rural areas and small communities; to make provision for access to Post Office services in such areas and communities; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Immigration (Time Limit on Detention)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for a maximum period of detention under the Immigration Act 1971 of 28 days; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Public Services (Availability)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the availability of public services during weekday evenings, at weekends and on bank holidays; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Counter-Terrorism and Border Security
items.description: To make provision in relation to terrorism; to make provision enabling persons at ports and borders to be questioned for national security and other related purposes; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Child Safety (Cycle Helmets)
items.description: A Bill to require children under 16 to wear a safety helmet when riding a bicycle on a public highway; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Local Government Finance
items.description: A Bill to provide for 100 per cent retention of locally collected business rates; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Supervised Drug Consumption Facilities
items.description: A Bill to make provision about supervised drug consumption facilities; to make it lawful to take controlled substances within such facilities in specified circumstances; and for connected purposes

items.title: Modern Slavery (Victim Support)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about identifying and supporting victims of modern slavery; and for connected purposes

items.title: Pension Benefits (Ill Health)
items.description: A Bill to require pension providers to make lump sum payments and other pension benefits available to people with ill health, including people with a terminal diagnosis, prior to such people reaching minimum pension age; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Middle Level
items.description: A Bill to amend and update the powers of the Middle Level Commissioners to regulate navigation on the Middle Level of the Fens in the city of Peterborough and the counties of Cambridgeshire and Norfolk; to make further provision as to the regulation of navigation on those waterways; to make other provision as to the Commissioners; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Access to Fertility Services
items.description: A Bill to make provision about access to NHS fertility services, including equality of access to such services across England; to make provision about pricing of such services; to provide for a minimum number of fertility treatments to be available to women on the basis of their age; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Courts (Abuse of Process)
items.description: A Bill to prevent abuse of process in civil and family courts; to make provision about cooperation between court jurisdictions; to create offences when certain civil and family court orders are breached; to amend the rights and duties of certain parties to prevent abuse of process in civil and family court; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Victims of Crime (Rights, Entitlements, and Notification of Child Sexual Abuse)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for specifying new statutory rights and entitlements for victims of crime under the Code of Practice for Victims of Crime; to require elected local policing bodies to assess victims services; to increase the duties of the Commissioner for Victims and Witnesses; to grant victims the right to request a review of a decision not to prosecute; to establish reviews in homicides where no criminal charge has been made; to create an obligation on professions to notify cases of possible victims of child sexual abuse; and for connected purposes

items.title: Armed Forces (Statute of Limitations)
items.description: A Bill to create statutory limitations on court proceedings against current and former members of the armed forces for certain alleged offences committed during military operations or similar circumstances; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Right to Die at Home
items.description: A Bill to create a right to die at home

items.title: Sanctions (Human Rights Abuse and Corruption)
items.description: A Bill to enable the Secretary of State to refuse entry, or to vary or curtail leave to enter or remain already granted, to a person who is a non-UK or non-EEA national who is known to be, or to have been, involved in gross human rights abuses or in certain acts of corruption; to make provision for financial sanctions against a person who is a non-UK or non-EEA national who is known to be, or to have been, involved in gross human rights abuses or in certain acts of corruption; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Genocide Determination
items.description: A Bill to provide for the High Court of England and Wales to make a preliminary finding on cases of alleged genocide; and for the subsequent referral of such findings to the International Criminal Court or a special tribunal

items.title: Physician Associates (Regulation)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the regulation of physician associates; to make physician associate a protected title; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Working Time (Regulations)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the expiration of the Working Time Regulations 1998; to provide for regulations governing working time; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Sanctions and Anti-Money Laundering
items.description: A bill to make provision enabling sanctions to be imposed where appropriate for the purposes of compliance with United Nations obligations or other international obligations or for the purposes of furthering the prevention of terrorism or for the purposes of national security or international peace and security or for the purposes of furthering foreign policy objectives; to make provision for the purposes of the detection, investigation and prevention of money laundering and terrorist financing and for the purposes of implementing Standards published by the Financial Action Task Force relating to combating threats to the integrity of the international financial system; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Youth (Services and Provisions)
items.description: A Bill to require the Secretary of State to promote and secure youth services and provision of a requisite standard; to impose a duty on local authorities to provide youth services and establish local youth service partnerships with youth participation; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Food Insecurity
items.description: A Bill to require the Government to monitor and report on food insecurity; to make provision for official statistics on food insecurity; and for connected purposes

items.title: Rivers Authorities and Land Drainage
items.description: A Bill to make provision about rivers authorities; to make provision about the expenses of internal drainage boards; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Electronic Cigarettes (Regulation)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the regulation of the sale and use of electronic cigarettes; to exempt electronic cigarettes from UK law derived from the Tobacco Products Directive; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Pets (Theft)
items.description: A Bill to amend the Animal Welfare Act 2006 and the Animal Health and Welfare (Scotland) Act 2006 to make the theft of pets an offence; to apply certain post-conviction powers under those Acts to such an offence; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Northern Ireland Budget
items.description:
A Bill to authorise the issue out of the Consolidated Fund of Northern Ireland of certain sums for the service of the year ending 31 March 2018; to appropriate those sums for specified purposes; to authorise the Department of Finance in Northern Ireland to borrow on the credit of the appropriated sums; to authorise the use for the public service of certain resources(including accruing resources) for the year ending 31 March 2018; and to repeal certain
spent provisions.

items.title: Leader of the House of Commons (Election)
items.description: A Bill to amend the House of Commons Administration Act 1978 to provide that the Prime Minister may only nominate as Leader of the House of Commons a Member of that House chosen following an election held amongst all Members of the House of Commons; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Channel 4 (Relocation)
items.description: A Bill to require Channel 4 to relocate its headquarters outside London; and for connected purposes.

items.title: International Development Assistance (Definition)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the definition of international development assistance; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Asset Freezing (Compensation)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the imposing of restrictions on assets owned by persons involved in conduct that gives support and assistance to terrorist organisations in the United Kingdom for the purpose of securing compensation for citizens of the United Kingdom affected by such conduct

items.title: Local Authorities (Removal of Council Tax Restrictions)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the removal of restrictions on principal local authorities in England to set levels of council tax; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Tobacco
items.description: A Bill to require the Secretary of State to report on means of requiring tobacco companies to meet the costs of smoking cessation services; to make provision about the advertising and marketing of products that are alternatives to tobacco; to require tobacco companies to publish information about their activities in relation to such products; to create an offence of selling tobacco without a licence; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Ceramics (Country of Origin Marking)
items.description: A Bill to require the indication of country of origin for ceramic products; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Civil Liability
items.description: A Bill to make provision about whiplash claims and the personal injury discount rate.

items.title: High Speed Rail (West Midlands - Crewe)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for a railway between a junction with Phase One of High Speed 2, near Fradley Wood in Staffordshire, and a junction with the West Coast Main Line near Crewe in Cheshire; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Duchy of Cornwall
items.description: A Bill to amend the succession to the title of the Duke of Cornwall, to remove various powers, exemptions and immunities from the Duchy of Cornwall, to make provisions relating to the Treasury Solicitor and any solicitor or attorney appointed in the affairs of the Duchy, and for connected purposes

items.title: Healthcare (Local Accountability)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the accountability of clinical commissioning groups; to make provision about local referendums on NHS sustainability and transformation plans; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Counsellors and Psychotherapists (Regulation) and Conversion Therapy
items.description: A Bill to provide that the Health and Care Professions Council be the regulatory body for counsellors and psychotherapists; to prohibit conversion therapy; to make related provision for the protection of children and adults; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Representation of the People (Young People's Enfranchisement)
items.description: A Bill to reduce the voting age to 16 in parliamentary and other elections; to make provision for auto-enrolment onto the electoral register for people aged 16 to 24; to make provision about the use of educational establishments as polling stations; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Extension of Franchise (House of Lords)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for Members of the House of Lords to vote in elections to the House of Commons

items.title: Ivory
items.description: A Bill to prohibit dealing in ivory, and for connected purposes.

items.title: Pensions (Review of Women's Arrangements) (No. 2)
items.description: A Bill to establish a review of pension arrangements for women affected by changes made by the Pensions Act 1995 and the Pensions Act 2011; to require the review in particular to undertake costings for a compensation scheme and consider the operation of section 1(4) of the Pensions Act 2011; and for connected purposes.

items.title: National Health Service (Co-Funding and Co-Payment)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for co-funding and for the extension of co-payment for NHS services in England; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Awards for Valour (Protection)
items.description: A Bill to prohibit the wearing of medals or insignia awarded for valour, with the intent to deceive

items.title: Clean Air (Human Rights)
items.description: A Bill to establish the right to breathe clean air; to require the Secretary of State to achieve and maintain clean air in England and Wales; to involve Public Health England in setting and reviewing pollutants and their limits; to enhance the powers, duties and functions of the Environment Agency, the Committee on Climate Change, local authorities (including port authorities), the Civil Aviation Authority, Highways England, Historic England and Natural England in relation to air pollution; to establish a Citizens’ Commission for Clean Air with powers to institute or intervene in legal proceedings; to require the Secretary of State and the relevant national authorities to apply environmental principles in carrying out their duties under this Act and the clean air enactments; and for connected purposes

items.title: North Northamptonshire (Urgent Care Facilities)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the restructuring of urgent care facilities in North Northamptonshire; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Taxation (Cross-border Trade)
items.description: A Bill to impose and regulate a duty of customs by reference to the importation of goods into the United Kingdom; to confer a power to impose and regulate a duty of customs by reference to the export of goods from the United Kingdom; to make other provision in relation to any duty of customs in connection with the withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the EU; to amend the law relating to value added tax, and the law relating to any excise duty on goods, in connection with that withdrawal; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Football Offences (Amendment)
items.description: A Bill to Amend section 3 of the Football Offences Act 1991.

items.title: Supply and Appropriation (Anticipation and Adjustments)
items.description:
To authorise the use of resources for the years ending with 31 March 2017, 31 March 2018 and 31 March 2019; to authorise the issue of sums out of the Consolidated Fund for the years ending 31 March 2018 and 31 March 2019; and to appropriate the supply
authorised by this Act for the years ending with 31 March 2017 and 31 March 2018.

items.title: Digital Economy Act 2017 (Amendment) (Definition of Extreme Pornography)
items.description: A Bill to amend the definition of extreme pornography in the Digital Economy Act 2017

items.title: Sublet Property (Offences)
items.description: A Bill to make the breach of certain rules relating to sub-letting rented accommodation a criminal offence; to make provision for criminal sanctions in respect of unauthorised sub-letting; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Fire Safety Information
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the requirements for fire safety information for occupants of certain buildings, including high-rise residential buildings.

items.title: Automatic Electoral Registration
items.description:
A bill to impose certain duties upon Her Majesty’s Government to ensure the accuracy, completeness and utility of electoral registers; to make provision for the sharing of data for the purposes
of electoral registration; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Food Advertising (Protection of Children from Targeting)
items.description: A Bill to prevent the marketing and advertising of food that does not meet certain nutritional requirements from being targeted at children.

items.title: Succession to Peerages
items.description: A Bill to amend the law regarding the succession to Peerages; and for connected purposes

items.title: Abortion
items.description: A Bill to amend the law relating to abortion in England and Wales, and Northern Ireland; to remove criminal liability in respect of abortion performed with the consent of the pregnant woman up to the twenty-fourth week of pregnancy; to repeal sections 59 and 60 of the Offences Against the Person Act 1861; to create offences of termination of a pregnancy after its twenty-fourth week and non-consensual termination of a pregnancy; to amend the law relating to conscientious objection to participation in abortion treatment; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Genocide Determination (No. 2)
items.description: A Bill to provide for the High Court of England and Wales to make a preliminary finding on cases of alleged genocide; and for the subsequent referral of such findings to the International Criminal Court or a special tribunal.

items.title: Electoral Commission (Duties)
items.description: A Bill to impose duties on the Electoral Commission to investigate allegations of electoral fraud and other breaches of electoral law and to act as the prosecuting authority for such offences; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Service Animals (Offences)
items.description: A Bill to make it an offence to attack service animals, including police dogs and horses; to make certain offences aggravated when perpetrated against such animals; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Child Maintenance (Assessment of Parents' Income)
items.description: A Bill to equalise the assessment and enforcement of child maintenance arrangements of children of self-employed parents with those of children of other employed parents; and for connected purposes.

items.title: School Uniforms
items.description: A Bill to require school governing bodies to implement affordability policies when setting school uniform requirements; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Non-Domestic Rating (Nursery Grounds)
items.description: To make provision for buildings used as nursery grounds to be exempt from nondomestic rates in England and Wales.

items.title: House of Commons Whips (Transparency)
items.description: A Bill to require the Government to publish details of meetings between the Government Whips Office in the House of Commons and the corresponding offices of other political parties in the House of Commons; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Road Traffic Offenders (Surrender of Driving Licences Etc)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the surrender, production or other delivery up of driving licences, or test certificates, in relation to certain offences; to make provision in relation to identifying persons in connection with fixed penalty notices, conditional offers and the payment of fixed penalties under the Road Traffic Offenders Act 1988; and for connected purposes

items.title: Employment Guarantee
items.description: A Bill to require the Secretary of State to guarantee paid employment for six months for claimants of Jobseeker’s Allowance, or the jobseeker’s component of Universal Credit, who have been unemployed for six months or longer; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Marriage (Same Sex Couples) (Northern Ireland)
items.description: A bill to make provision for the marriage of same sex couples in Northern Ireland; to make provision for the legal recognition of the same sex marriage of armed forces personnel overseas and of other same sex marriages solemnised outside Northern Ireland; to make provision in the law of Northern Ireland for the conversion of civil partnerships to marriages and for the review of civil partnerships; to make provision for rights to pensions and social security contributions for same sex married couples and civil partners; to make provision for gender change by married persons and civil partners; and for connected purposes

items.title: Electric Vehicles (Standardised Recharging)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about standardised requirements for electric vehicle charge points; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Vagrancy (Repeal)
items.description: Repeal the Vagrancy Act 1824

items.title: Telecommunications Infrastructure (Relief from Non-Domestic Rates)
items.description: A Bill to make provision enabling relief from non-domestic rates in England and Wales to be conferred in respect of hereditaments used for the purposes of facilitating the transmission of communications by any means involving the use of electrical or electromagnetic energy; and for connected purposes.

items.title: International Development Assistance (Limit)
items.description: A Bill to impose a limit on the level of international development assistance at an amount equal to the European Union average of equivalent expenditure; and for connected purposes.

items.title: British Indian Ocean Territory (Citizenship)
items.description: A Bill to allow persons descended from individuals born in the British Indian Ocean Territory to register as British overseas territories citizens; and for connected purposes.

items.title: General Election (Leaders’ Debate)
items.description: A Bill to set up a commission to make arrangements for debates between leaders of political parties during a General Election; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Conscientious Objection (Medical Activities)
items.description: A Bill to clarify the extent to which a medical practitioner with a conscientious objection may refrain from participating in certain medical activities; and for connected purposes

items.title: Electoral Candidate (Age)
items.description: A Bill to allow a person who is age 18 or older on the day of a parliamentary or local election to stand as a candidate; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Agriculture
items.description: A Bill To authorise new expenditure for certain agricultural and other purposes; to make provision about direct payments during an agricultural transition period following the United Kingdom’s departure from the European Union; to make provision about the acquisition and use of information connected with food supply chains; to confer power to respond to exceptional market conditions affecting agricultural markets; to confer power to modify retained direct EU legislation relating to agricultural and rural development payments and public market intervention and private storage aid; to make provision about marketing standards and the classification of carcasses; to make provision for the recognition of associations of agricultural producers which may benefit from certain exemptions from competition law; to confer power to make regulations about contracts for the purchase of agricultural products from agricultural producers and securing compliance with the WTO Agreement on Agriculture; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Free Trade (Education and Reporting)
items.description: A Bill to impose duties relating to the provision of public education on free trade; to require regular reports from government on trade arrangements with other countries; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Criminal Records (Childhood Offences)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the criminal records of persons aged under 18 on the day an offence was committed; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Drone (Regulation)
items.description: A Bill to regulate the purchase and use of drones weighing 5 kilograms or more; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Planning (Agent of Change)
items.description: A Bill to require specified planning controls in relation to developments likely to be affected by existing noise sources; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Automatic Electoral Registration (No. 2)
items.description: A Bill to impose certain duties upon Her Majesty’s Government to ensure the accuracy, completeness and utility of electoral registers; to make provision for the sharing of data for the purposes of electoral registration; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Mental Capacity (Amendment)
items.description: A Bill to amend the Mental Capacity Act 2005 in relation to procedures in accordance with which a person may be deprived of liberty where the person lacks capacity to consent, and for connected purposes

items.title: Elections and Referendums (Advertising)
items.description: A Bill to amend the Political Parties, Elections and Referendums Act 2000 to improve transparency in respect of election and referendum material

items.title: Registration of Marriage
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the registration of marriages.

items.title: Local Electricity
items.description: A Bill to enable electricity generators to become local electricity suppliers; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Policing Resources
items.description: A Bill to make provision for ensuring that police forces in England and Wales have sufficient resources to deliver police services; and for connected purposes

items.title: Supply and Appropriation (Main Estimates)
items.description: To authorise the use of resources for the year ending with 31 March 2019; to authorise both the issue of sums out of the Consolidated Fund and the application of income for that year; and to appropriate the supply authorised for that year by this Act and by the Supply and Appropriation (Anticipation and Adjustments) Act 2018.

items.title: Multi-employer Pension Schemes
items.description: A Bill to make provision about multi-employer pension schemes, including provision for the protection of unincorporated businesses, such as plumbing businesses, from certain multi-employer pension scheme liabilities; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Homes (Fitness for Human Habitation)
items.description: To amend the Landlord and Tenant Act 1985 to require that residential rented accommodation is provided and maintained in a state of fitness for human habitation; to amend the Building Act 1984 to make provision about the liability for works on residential accommodation that do not comply with Building Regulations; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Nappies (Environmental Standards)
items.description: A Bill to establish environmental standards for nappies; to make provision about the advertising and promotion of nappies with regard to those standards; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Social Justice Commission
items.description: To amend the law relating to the Social Mobility Commission.

items.title: Holocaust (Return of Cultural Objects) (Amendment)
items.description: A Bill to prevent the Holocaust (Return of Cultural Objects) Act 2009 from expiring on 11 November 2019.

items.title: Licensing of Taxis and Private Hire Vehicles (Safeguarding and Road Safety)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the exercise of taxi and private hire vehicle licensing functions in relation to persons about whom there are safeguarding or road safety concerns; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Assaults on Retail Workers (Offences)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about offences when perpetrated against retail workers; to make certain offences aggravated when perpetrated against such workers in the course of their employment; and for connected purposes.

items.title: European Union (Return of Contributions)
items.description: A Bill to require the Government to obtain, on withdrawal from the European Union, a payment from the European Union not less than 50 per cent of the United Kingdom’s net contributions to that institution; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Haulage Permits and Trailer Registration
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the international transport of goods by road; to make provision about the registration of trailers; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Local Roads (Investment)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the maintenance and repair of roads by local authorities in England; to make provision for prescribing the use of funds for this purpose; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Child Maintenance
items.description: A Bill to remove certain fees for child maintenance services; to make provision about the calculation of child maintenance payments; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Student Loans (Debt Discharge)
items.description: A Bill to make provision about the forgiveness or discharge of student loan debt in certain circumstances; to make provision about the treatment of student loan debt in bankruptcy proceedings; and for connected purposes.

items.title: June Bank Holiday (Creation)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for a national public holiday on 23 June or the subsequent weekday when 23 June falls at a weekend; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Prime Minister (Temporary Replacement)
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the carrying out of the functions of the Prime Minister in the event that a Prime Minister, or a person temporarily carrying out the functions of the Prime Minister, is incapacitated; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Finance (No. 3)
items.description: A Bill to grant certain duties, to alter other duties, and to amend the law relating to the national debt and the public revenue, and to make further provision in connection with finance.

items.title: Finance (No.2)
items.description: A Bill to grant certain duties, to alter other duties, and to amend the law relating to the national debt and the public revenue, and to make further provision in connection with finance.

items.title: Collective Defined Contribution Pension Schemes
items.description: A Bill to enable the establishment of collective defined contribution pension schemes; and for connected purposes.

items.title: High Speed 2 Phase 1 (Reviews of Public Expenditure)
items.description: A Bill to require the carrying out and publication of reviews of the level of public expenditure in connection with the High Speed 2 rail line (Phase 1); to establish procedures in connection with changes in these levels; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Deregulation
items.description: A Bill to make provision for the reduction of burdens resulting from legislation for businesses or other organisations or for individuals; to make provision for the repeal or amendment of regulations; to make provision about the exercise of regulatory powers and functions; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Unsolicited Calls (Prevention)
items.description: A Bill to make provision to prevent unsolicited calls; and for connected purposes.

items.title: Employment Opportunities
items.description: A Bill to introduce more freedom, flexibility and opportunity for those seeking employment in the public and private sector; and for connected purposes.

items.title: BBC Licence Fee
items.description: A Bill to establish the BBC Licence Fee Commission to make recommendations to the Secretary of State on a settlement for BBC funding from 1 April 2022, after conducting public and parliamentary consultation
